post.description:
Submit user feedback.

This function stores the provided feedback data.

To submit feedback:

get.description:
Retrieve the runtime configuration.

Currently, this is the session ID and runtime ID (if available).
Search through the event stream with filtering and pagination.

Get all microagents associated with the conversation.

This endpoint returns all repository and knowledge microagents that are loaded for the conversation.

post.description:
Initialize a new session or join an existing one.

After successful initialization, the client should connect to the WebSocket
using the returned conversation ID.

schema.title: Response Get Conversation Api Conversations  Conversation Id  Get
Response Delete Conversation Api Conversations  Conversation Id  Delete

patch.description:
Update conversation metadata.

This endpoint allows updating conversation details like title.
Only the conversation owner can update the conversation.

schema.title: Response Update Conversation Api Conversations  Conversation Id  Patch

post.description:
Start an agent loop for a conversation.

This endpoint calls the conversation_manager's maybe_start_agent_loop method
to start a conversation. If the conversation is already running, it will
return the existing agent loop info.

Stop an agent loop for a conversation.

This endpoint calls the conversation_manager's close_session method
to stop a conversation.

Response 401 Load Settings Api Settings Get
Response 200 Store Settings Api Settings Post
Response 500 Store Settings Api Settings Post

get.description:
Scan the microagents directory of a repository and return the list of microagents.

The microagents directory location depends on the git provider and actual repository name:
- If git provider is not GitLab and actual repository name is ".openhands": scans "microagents" folder
- If git provider is GitLab and actual repository name is "openhands-config": scans "microagents" folder
- Otherwise: scans ".openhands/microagents" folder

schema.title: Response Get Repository Microagents Api User Repository  Repository Name  Microagents Get

get.description: Fetch the content of a specific microagent file from a repository.

parameters.name: file_path

schema.description: Path to the microagent file within the repository
schema.title: File Path

parameters.description: Path to the microagent file within the repository

get.description:
Get trajectory.

This function retrieves the current trajectory and returns it.

GETSettingsModel.title: GETSettingsModel
GETSettingsModel.description: Settings with additional token data for the frontend

MCPConfig.title: MCPConfig
MCPConfig.description:
Configuration for MCP (Message Control Protocol) settings.

Attributes:
    sse_servers: List of MCP SSE server configs
    stdio_servers: List of MCP stdio server configs. These servers will be added to the MCP Router running inside runtime container.
    shttp_servers: List of MCP HTTP server configs.

MCPSSEServerConfig.title: MCPSSEServerConfig
MCPSSEServerConfig.description:
Configuration for a single MCP server.

Attributes:
    url: The server URL
    api_key: Optional API key for authentication

MCPStdioServerConfig.title: MCPStdioServerConfig
MCPStdioServerConfig.description:
Configuration for a MCP server that uses stdio.

Attributes:
    name: The name of the server
    command: The command to run the server
    args: The arguments to pass to the server
    env: The environment variables to set for the server

MicroagentContentResponse.title: MicroagentContentResponse
MicroagentContentResponse.description: Response model for individual microagent content endpoint.

MicroagentResponse.title: MicroagentResponse
MicroagentResponse.description:
Response model for microagents endpoint.

Note: This model only includes basic metadata that can be determined
without parsing microagent content. Use the separate content API
to get detailed microagent information.

UpdateConversationRequest.title: UpdateConversationRequest
UpdateConversationRequest.description: Request model for updating conversation metadata.
